intro: Codonoboea kjellbergii, commonly known as the Kjellberg's codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Codonoboea kjellbergii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
